name: CMPT 110
description: BC Mathematics 12 (or equivalent) or any 100-level MATH course with a minimum grade of C-. Students who have obtained credit for, or are currently enrolled in a computing science course at the 200-level or higher, or ITEC 240, 241 or 242 may not take CMPT 110 for further credit except with permission of the School of Computing Science. Quantitative.

name: CMPT 120
description: BC Math 12 or equivalent is recommended.  Students with credit for CMPT 102, 128, 130 or 166 may not take this course for further credit. Students who have taken CMPT 125, 129, 130 or 135 first may not then take this course for further credit. Quantitative/Breadth-Science.

name: CMPT 125
description: CMPT 120 or CMPT 130, with a minimum grade of C-. Students with credit for CMPT 126, 129, 135 or CMPT 200 or higher may not take this course for further credit. Quantitative.

name: CMPT 128
description: BC Math 12 (or equivalent, or any of MATH 100, 150, 151, 154, or 157, with a minimum grade of C-). Students with credit for CMPT 102, 120, 130 or 166 may not take this course for further credit. Students who have taken CMPT 125, 129, 135, or CMPT 200 or higher first may not then take this course for further credit. Quantitative/Breadth-Science.

name: CMPT 129
description: CMPT 102 or CMPT 120, with a minimum grade of C-. Students with credit for CMPT 125 or 135 may not take this course for further credit. Quantitative.

name: CMPT 130
description: BC Math 12 (or equivalent, or any of MATH 100, 150, 151, 154, or 157, with a minimum grade of C-). Students with credit for CMPT 102, 120, 128 or 166 may not take this course for further credit. Students who have taken CMPT 125, 129 or 135 first may not then take this course for further credit. Quantitative/Breadth-Science.

name: CMPT 135
description: CMPT 130 with a minimum grade of C-. Students with credit for CMPT 125, 126, or 129 may not take this course for further credit. Quantitative.

name: CMPT 166
description: Recommended: BC Math 12 or equivalent. Students with credit for CMPT 102, 120, 128 or 130 may not take this course for further credit. Students who have taken CMPT 125, 129 or 135 first may not then take this course for further credit. Quantitative/Breadth-Science.

name: CMPT 201
description: (CMPT 125 or CMPT 135) and MACM 101, both with a minimum grade of C-. Students who have taken CMPT 300 first may not then take this course for further credit.

name: CMPT 210
description: MACM 101, MATH 152, CMPT 125 or CMPT 135, and (MATH 240 or MATH 232), all with a minimum grade of C-.

name: CMPT 213
description: CMPT 225 with a minimum grade of C-. Students with credit for CMPT 212 cannot take this course for further credit.

name: CMPT 225
description: (MACM 101 and (CMPT 125, CMPT 129 or CMPT 135)) or (ENSC 251 and ENSC 252), all with a minimum grade of C-. Quantitative.

name: CMPT 263
description: CMPT 125 or CMPT 135, with a minimum grade of C-.

name: CMPT 272
description: CMPT 120 or CMPT 130 or CMPT 128, with a minimum grade of C-.

name: CMPT 275
description: One W course, CMPT 225, (MACM 101 or (ENSC 251 and ENSC 252)) and (MATH 151 or MATH 150), all with a minimum grade of C-. MATH 154 or MATH 157 with at least a B+ may be substituted for MATH 151 or MATH 150. Students with credit for CMPT 276 may not take this course for further credit.

name: CMPT 276
description: One W course, CMPT 225, (MACM 101 or (ENSC 251 and ENSC 252)) and (MATH 151 or MATH 150), all with a minimum grade of C-. MATH 154 or MATH 157 with at least a B+ may be substituted for MATH 151 or MATH 150. Students with credit for CMPT 275 may not take this course for further credit.

name: CMPT 295
description: Either (MACM 101 and (CMPT 125 or CMPT 135)) or (MATH 151 and CMPT 102 for students in an Applied Physics program), all with a minimum grade of C-.

name: CMPT 300
description: CMPT 225 and (CMPT 295 or ENSC 254), all with a minimum grade of C-.

name: CMPT 303
description: CMPT 225, (CMPT 295 or ENSC 254), and (CMPT 201 or ENSC 351), all with a minimum grade of C-.

name: CMPT 305
description: CMPT 225, (MACM 101 or (ENSC 251 and ENSC 252)) and (STAT 270 or STAT 271), all with a minimum grade of C-.

name: CMPT 307
description: CMPT 225, (MACM 201 or CMPT 210), (MATH 150 or MATH 151), and (MATH 232 or MATH 240), all with a minimum grade of C-. MATH 154 or MATH 157 with a grade of at least B+ may be substituted for MATH 150 or MATH 151.

name: CMPT 308
description: (MACM 201 or CMPT 210) with a minimum grade of C-.

name: CMPT 310
description: CMPT 225 and (MACM 101 or (ENSC 251 and ENSC 252)), all with a minimum grade of C-.

name: CMPT 318
description: CMPT 225 with a minimum grade of C-. Additional prerequisites to be determined by the instructor subject to approval by the undergraduate program chair.

name: CMPT 320
description: A CMPT course with a minimum grade of C- and 45 units. Breadth-Science.

name: CMPT 340
description: Completion of 60 units including one of CMPT 125, 126, 128, 135, with a minimum grade of C- or CMPT 102 with a grade of B or higher.

name: CMPT 353
description: CMPT 225 and (BUS 232, STAT 201, STAT 203, STAT 205, STAT 270, STAT 271, ENSC 280, MSE 210, or SEE 241), with a minimum grade of C-.

name: CMPT 354
description: CMPT 225 and (MACM 101 or (ENSC 251 and ENSC 252)), all with a minimum grade of C-.

name: CMPT 361
description: CMPT 225 and MATH 232 or 240, all with a minimum grade of C-.

name: CMPT 362
description: CMPT 225 with a minimum grade of C-. Students with credit for IAT 359 may not take this course for further credit.

name: CMPT 363
description: CMPT 225 and CMPT 263, both with a minimum grade of C-.

name: CMPT 365
description: CMPT 225 with a minimum grade of C-.

name: CMPT 371
description: CMPT 225 and (MATH 151 or MATH 150), with a minimum grade of C-. MATH 154 or MATH 157 with a grade of at least B+ may be substituted for MATH 151 (MATH 150).

name: CMPT 372
description: CMPT 272 and CMPT 225, both with a minimum grade of C-. Students with credit for CMPT 470 may not take this course for further credit.

name: CMPT 373
description: CMPT 276 or 275, with a minimum grade of C-.

name: CMPT 376W
description: CMPT 105W and (CMPT 275 or CMPT 276), with a minimum grade of C-. Writing.

name: CMPT 379
description: (MACM 201 or CMPT 210), (CMPT 295 or ENSC 215) and CMPT 225, all with a minimum grade of C-.

name: CMPT 383
description: CMPT 225 and (MACM 101 or (ENSC 251 and ENSC 252)), all with a minimum grade of C-.

name: CMPT 384
description: CMPT 225 and (MACM 101 or (ENSC 251 and ENSC 252)), all with a minimum grade of C-.

name: CMPT 400
description: CMPT 361 and MACM 316, both with a minimum grade of C-. Recommended: MATH 251. Students who have taken CMPT 469 under the title "3D Computer Vision" offered in Spring 2024 may not take this course for further credit.

name: CMPT 403
description: CMPT 201 or CMPT 300, with a minimum grade of C-.

name: CMPT 404
description: (MACM 201 or CMPT 210) with a minimum grade of C-. CMPT 307 and 308 are recommended.

description: CMPT 307 with a minimum grade of C-.

name: CMPT 406
description: CMPT 307 with a minimum grade of C-.

name: CMPT 407
description: CMPT 307 with a minimum grade of C-. CMPT 308 is recommended.

name: CMPT 409
description: CMPT 307 with a minimum grade of C-.

name: CMPT 410
description: CMPT 310 and MACM 316, both with a minimum grade of C-. Students with credit for CMPT 419 under the title "Machine Learning" may not take this course for further credit.

name: CMPT 411
description: Completion of nine units in Computing Science upper division courses or, in exceptional cases, permission of the instructor.

name: CMPT 412
description: CMPT 361 and MATH 152, both with a minimum grade of C-.

name: CMPT 413
description: Completion of nine units in Computing Science upper division courses or, in exceptional cases, permission of the instructor.

name: CMPT 420
description: CMPT 410 or CMPT 419 (Machine Learning), with a minimum grade of C-. Students with credit for CMPT 728 may not take this course for further credit.

name: CMPT 426
description: Students must complete Bridging Online (visit www.sfu.ca/coop/bol for further details) at least two terms before their anticipated co-op placement. Students must then enroll with the co-op program by the second week of the term preceding the work term. Normally, students will have completed a minimum of 45 units by the end of the term of application, CMPT 275 or 276, and have a minimum CGPA of 2.50.

name: CMPT 427
description: CMPT 426, CGPA of 2.50.

name: CMPT 428
description: CMPT 427, CGPA of 2.50.

name: CMPT 429
description: CMPT 428, CGPA of 2.50.

name: CMPT 430
description: CMPT 429, CGPA of 2.50.

description: (CMPT 201 or CMPT 300) and CMPT 371, both with a minimum grade of C-. Students with credit for CMPT 401 before September 2008 may not take this course for further credit.

name: CMPT 433
description: (CMPT 201 or CMPT 300) and CMPT 295, with a minimum grade of C-.

name: CMPT 441
description: CMPT 307 with a minimum grade of C-.  Students with credit for CMPT 341 may not take this course for further credit.

description: CMPT 275 or CMPT 276, (MACM 201 or CMPT 210) , all with a minimum grade of C- and 15 units of upper division courses. Recommended: Co-op experience.

name: CMPT 493
description: CMPT 275 or CMPT 276, at least 80 units, CGPA and UDGPA over 3.0, enrolled in any CS major program. Participation in the practicum is competitive and an application must be submitted to the Undergraduate Chair by a defined due date announced each term.

name: CMPT 494
description: Students must have completed at least 15 units of upper division CMPT courses. Successful Capstone Project Proposal.

name: CMPT 495
description: CMPT 494 with a minimum grade of C-. CMPT 495 must be taken in the term immediately following the successful completion of CMPT 494 and must be for the same project and faculty supervisor.

name: CMPT 496
description: Students must have completed 90 units, including 15 units of upper division CMPT courses, and have a GPA of at least 3.00. The proposal must be submitted to the undergraduate chair at least 15 days in advance of the term. The proposal must be signed by the supervisor(s) and the undergraduate chair.

name: CMPT 497
description: Submission of a satisfactory capstone project proposal.

name: CMPT 498
description: Students must have completed 90 units, including 15 units of upper division CMPT courses, and have a GPA of at least 3.00. The proposal must be submitted to the Undergraduate Chair at least 15 days in advance of the term. The proposal must be signed by the supervisor(s) and the undergraduate chair.

name: CMPT 499
description: CMPT 250 or ENSC 250, with a minimum grade of C-.

name: CMPT 626
description: 12 units of CMPT coursework at the 700-level or higher with a CGPA of at least 3.0. Department Consent is required for enrollment.

name: CMPT 627
description: CMPT 626 and a CGPA of at least 3.0. Department Consent is required for enrollment.

name: CMPT 628
description: CMPT 627 and a CGPA of at least 3.0. Department Consent is required for enrollment.

name: CMPT 629

name: CMPT 631
description: 12 units of CMPT course work with an SFU CGPA of at least 3.0. Approval of supervisor and a GPC representative is required prior to applying for, or accepting an internship.

name: CMPT 721
description: CMPT 310/710 recommended. Cross-listed course with CMPT 411.

description: CMPT 361 or equivalent and CMPT 726.

name: CMPT 750
description: Recommended: CMPT 295 or equivalent. Students with credit for CMPT 450 may not take this course for further credit.

name: CMPT 757
description: This course is only available to students enrolled into the Visual Computing Specialization of the Professional Master's program in Computer Science.

name: CMPT 764
description: CMPT 361, MACM 316.  Students with credit for CMPT 464 or equivalent may not take this course for further credit.
